sentence.Network_en: He'd spent his boyhood summers mucking about in boats.
sentence.Network_cn: 他小时候，夏天都是在船上浑打胡闹度过的。

sentence.Network_en: I'm sure you will remember from the hellish years of your boyhood.
sentence.Network_cn: 我相信你一定记得自己梦魇般的童年时代的事情。

sentence.Network_en: He has been a Derby County supporter since boyhood.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从孩提时代起就是德比郡队的支持者。

list.abs: I grew into boyhood on the place and got my first impressions of life there ., 我成长为少年时代的地方 , 得到人生我的第一印象那里.
the threshold from childhood to boyhood ., 从幼年到童年的伙伴.
In Taipei he met a boyhood chum., 他在台北遇见一位童年时期的拍档.
While losing his son undoubtedly reawakened those old boyhood memories ., 失去骨肉无疑又唤醒了他对旧时童年的记忆,

entry.def: Boyhood is the period of a male person's life during which he is a boy.

example.ex: He has been a Derby County supporter since boyhood.
example.tran: 他从孩提时代起就是德比郡队的支持者。

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,多加在名词后,"时期,性质"等

stems_affixes.word_buile: bachelor单身汉+hood时期,性质→n.独身,独身生活
boy男孩+hood时期,性质→n.少年时代[期]
child儿童+hood时期,性质→n.幼年,童年
false错误的+hood表示状态→n.错误;撒谎
hardi=hardy勇敢的+hood时期,性质→n.大胆,鲁莽
likeli=likely可能的+hood时期,性质→n.可能性

Sentence.sentence: I spent my boyhood climbing trees on Streatham Common, South London.

sentences.en: The accordion music reminds me of my boyhood.
sentences.cn: 这手风琴的乐声让我回忆起了我的少年时代。

sentences.en: The scene woke memories of my boyhood.
sentences.cn: 这幕情景使我回忆起童年的往事。

sentences.en: His boyhood conditioned him to hardship.
sentences.cn: 他的少年时代使他习惯于逆境。
